english: to charge; to fill; to act in place of; sufficient

etymology.description: 서(充) (shān, "spear") + 儿(人, "person") = person with a spear filling space -> to fill
etymology.interpretation: The character 充(充) combines the idea of a person 儿 holding or wielding a spear or decorative object 氍, representing the act of filling or occupying a position. It effectively conveys the concept of 'filling up' or acting in place of someone, as it involves an agent (the person) and an object or action.

examples.chinese: 手机需要充电(手機需要充電)。
examples.english: The phone needs to be charged.

examples.chinese: 他充当(他充當)，班长的角色(班長的角色)。
examples.english: He acted as the class monitor.

examples.chinese: 水箱充满了雨水(水箱充滿了雨水)。
examples.english: The water tank is filled with rainwater.
